DataElement.preferredName: Disability Impaired Vision Or Unable to See Well Enough Even With Correction Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response to indicate whether or not a physical impairment exists that results in an individual's vision loss not correctable by glasses.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disability Impaired Vision Or Unable to See Well Enough Even With Correction
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any physical or mental impairment that interferes with an individual's ability to perform desired activities._Sight that is impaired._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A response indicating that an individual is or was unable to see well enough even with glasses or contact lenses.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any physical or mental impairment that interferes with an individual's ability to perform desired activities.

Concepts.definition: Any physical or mental impairment that interferes with an individual's ability to perform desired activities.

Property.preferredName: Impaired Vision Or Unable to See Well Enough even with Correction
Property.preferredDefinition: Sight that is impaired.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A response indicating that an individual is or was unable to see well enough even with glasses or contact lenses.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

Concepts.longName: Unable to See Well Enough even with Correction
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is or was unable to see well enough even with glasses or contact lenses.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
